data.title: Boston Public Radio
data.meta_description: Join hosts Jim Braude and Margery Eagan for a smart local conversation with leaders and thinkers shaping Boston and New England. We feature our favorite conversation from each show.
data.text:
BPR Full Show 8/09: Olympics Check In

We opened the lines to discuss working mothers and taking maternity leave. Grace Kelly, a Wellesley/Brookline native who's made a name for herself on the saxophone – performing Obama's 2009 inauguration at 16, playing with Stephen Colbert's Late Show band, and now performed at the Boston Public Library for Live Music Friday. Callie Crossley discussed some political headlines and latest on the election. Nancy Gertner reacted to the latest on Dems pushing for Supreme Court reform, more revelations about undisclosed private flights taken by Clarence Thomas, and other court-related headlines. James Bennett talked about takeaways from Olympics bingeing, some upcoming shows in the Boston area he's excited about, and his top "Boston" movie. Jimmy Liang & Monica Glass are owners of two burgeoning Boston bakeries. Jimmy owns the French bakery Niveaux Patisserie in Quincy and Monica owns the gluten-free mecca known as Verviene in Central Square. We ended the show by having an Olympics check-in.

BPR Full Show 8/09: Olympics Check In

Listen · 2:14:48 2:14:48

Best Of BPR 8/08: Sen. Elizabeth Warren & MA Ice Cream Trail

Today: Shirley Leung of the Boston Globe fills in for Jim. We talk with Senator Elizabeth Warren about Election 2024, housing, and Massachusetts' migrant crisis And, Massachusetts now has an Ice Cream Trail! We speak with Kate Fox of Mass' office of travel and tourism ... and Joe Prestejohn of Cabot's in Newton brings enough ice cream to satiate all of GBH.

Best Of BPR 8/08: Sen. Elizabeth Warren & MA Ice Cream Trail

Listen · 37:01 37:01

BPR Full Show 8/8: We Scream for Ice Cream

Sen. Elizabeth Warren joined us in studio to discuss the Harris-Walz ticket, Steward hospital closures, her $550 billion housing bill, and more. Then we opened up the phone lines to talk about the vice presidential picks: Vance and Walz. Former secretary of public safety Andrea Cabral joins for a breakdown the Heritage Foundation's Project 2025. Food policy analyst Corby Kummer discussed 100 years of the Caesar salad, dangerous bacteria found in oysters harvested off Cape Cod, and climate change impacts on the wine industry. Kate Fox & Joe Prestejohn join to talk about the debut of the Massachusetts Ice Cream Trail. Kate Fox is Executive Director for the Massachusetts Office of Travel & Tourism and Joe is the owner of Newton ice cream institution Cabot's. Amherst College's Ilan Stavans lends his perspective on recent headlines around antisemitism. He talks about how it's fueling hate groups in the UK and how college students are learning how to speak out. We ended the show to talk about ice cream. Where are the best scoops? What is the best flavor?

BPR Full Show 8/8: We Scream for Ice Cream

Listen · 2:37:13 2:37:13

Best Of BPR 8/07: Families Of Hamas Hostages Accuse Netanyahu Of Intentionally Delaying De...

Today: We talk with Maya Roman & Alon Gat, family members of Israeli hostages held by Hamas, about their efforts to keep public eye on the dozens of people who remain held in captivity while the war rages on. And, Sky & Telescope senior editor Kelly Beatty explains the Perseid Meteor showers to us, ahead of peak viewing this weekend.

Best Of BPR 8/07: Families Of Hamas Hostages Accuse Netanyahu Of Intentionally Delaying De...

Listen · 38:54 38:54

BPR Full Show 8/07: Shot Spotter

We opened the lines to talk about quiet vacationing. GBH executive arts editor Jared Bowen discussed the Queen of Versailles, playing at Colonial Theatre through the summer; and Utah banning 13 books from all public schools. Maya Roman and Alon Gat, relatives of Israelis held hostage by Hamas, discussed their concerns that Netanyahu is prolonging the war for political gain. Ian Cain, running to unseat Elizabeth Warren in the Senate, joined to share why he's running. Kelly Beatty, senior editor of Sky and Telescope, discussed the Perseid Meteor Shower this weekend; and moon caves. Ralph Clark is CEO of Shot Spotter, he joined with former police commissioner Bill Bratton to discuss how the technology is used to detect gunshots. AITA for not sleeping at the same time as my partner?

BPR Full Show 8/07: Shot Spotter

Listen · 2:31:01 2:31:01

BPR Full Show 8/06: Mayor Wu Supports Residential Tax

Mayor Wu answered audience questions. Sue O'Connell discussed the identity controversy around Olympic boxer Imani Khelif, and continued fallout after the Karen Read trial. Carol Rose of the ACLU of Mass discussed the end of Mass' legislative session and general transparency on Beacon Hill. Urban Grape owners TJ and Hadley Douglas discussed summer wines. CNN's John King spoke about Tim Walz as Harris' pick for her running mate. We ended the show by discussing RFK's decision to leave a dead bear in Central Park.

BPR Full Show 8/06: Mayor Wu Supports Residential Tax

Listen · 2:37:31 2:37:31

BPR Full Show 8/5:The Best is What's Inside

Boston Globe reporters Matt Stout & Samantha Gross join to discuss the dysfunctional legislature. Trenni Casey with NBC Sports Boston runs through Paris Olympics highlights Medical ethicist Art Caplan on controversial brain research at New York's Mount Sinai, TikTok collecting users' political data, a new approach to mental health treatment in Mississippi and his take on the ethics of AI-led insurance authorization. The Groundtruth Project's Charlie Sennott discussed the killing of Hamas' political leader, Maduro's hold on power in Venezuela, and behind-the-scenes on the prisoner swap that freed WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich. Nick Quah reviews podcasts for Vulture. He shares his summer listening recommendations.

BPR Full Show 8/5:The Best is What's Inside

Listen · 2:18:08 2:18:08

Best Of BPR 8/05: Trenni On The Olympics And Fridge-Scaping

Today on the podcast. Jim Braude and Margery Eagan speak with NBC Sports Boston's Trenni Casey on the highlights – and lowlights– from the Olympics so far – including Margery's latest obsession ... dressage. Then we open the lines to talk about fridge-decorating, apparently it's the latest trend on Instagram.

Best Of BPR 8/05: Trenni On The Olympics And Fridge-Scaping

Listen · 39:58 39:58
